choices.text: It is most common type of shoulder dislocation.
Patient keeps his arm in saluting position.
Injury to brachial plexus may occur.

questions.text: Which of the following is true about anterior shoulder dislocation?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A- Anterior dislocation is the M/C shoulder dislocation and the M/C type is subcoracoid. Option B- M/C type of shoulder dislocation is subcoracoid. Option C-In anterior shoulder,patient`s arm is abducted and elbow is supported by other hand. Option D-M/C nerve injured in shoulder dislocation is axillary nerve.

questions.text: Hamilton Ruler test sign is positive in which of the above mentioned conditions?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Hamilton's ruler sign is positive when the tip of the acromion may be joined to the lateral epicondyle of the humerus with a straight line.This indicates a dislocated shoulder, with the resulting loss of the normal prominence of the humeral head. Option B-Acromioclavicular joint dislocation can be tested by AC joint compression test. Option C-Posterior dislocation of shoulder is less common as compared to anterior shoulder dislocation,hence, option A is better answer. Option D-luxatio erecta is another name for inferior shoulder dislocation which is again less common than anterior shoulder dislocation.

questions.text: An adult patient reported to emergency with limited adduction and Internal rotation with the following xray Diagnosis is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Limited adduction & Internal Rotation with this xray is s/o anterior dislocation shoulder as head of humerus can be seen anteroinferior to glenoid cavity Option B-Empty glenoid sign and light bulb sign are seen inposterior dislocation of shoulder. Option C-superior dislocation of shoulder is not seen commonly. Option C-inferior dislocation of shoulder is seen only in1-2%.

questions.text: Nerve injured in anterior dislocation of shoulder?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Radial nerve is injured in spiral groove fracture of humerus. Option B-Axillary nerve is the M/C nerve injured in anterior dislocation of shoulder. Option C-long thoracic nerve is injured during surgical procedures of breast and causes winging of scapula. Option D-median nerve is injured in carpal tunnel syndrome.

questions.text: Neglected shoulder dislocation in a young labourer is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-neglected shoulder dislocation is not managed medically. Option B-Neglected shoulder dislocation in a young labourer (i.e high demand patient ) is managed surgically, as it is very difficult to reduce the shoulder by traction alone . Option C-The deformity has to be corrected.we cannot neglect it further. Option D-The deformity has to be corrected.we cannot just counsel and send the patient back,

choices.text: Pain is severe in anterior dislocation
Radiography may be misleading in posterior dislocation

questions.text: Which is true regarding shoulder dislocation?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A-Posterior dislocation is often overlooked , thus it is also k/s missed injury as the condition is minimally painful. Option B-pain is severe in anterior shoulder dislocation as the capsule of shoulder joint is relatively tight anteriorly. Option C-It is also very difficult to diagnose the same on X ray but X ray may show signs such as empty glenoid sign and light bulb appearance. Option D-All of the above are correct.

questions.text: Shoulder X- Ray highest bony landmark is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Option A-greater tuberosity is a part of humerus and therefore it is visible below the acromion in given below xray. Option B-lesser tuberosity is a part of humerus and therefore it is visible below the acromion in given below xray. Option C-head of humerus is present below acromion process. Option D-Acromion is the highest bony landmark on xray of shoulder joint as seen below.

questions.text: Zanca’s view is done for ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A- zanca’s view is done for AC joint dislocation. Option B,C,D-zanca view is not done for these conditions.

questions.text: First movement to be restricted in frozen shoulder is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) In frozen shoulder (also known as adhesive capsulitis), the first movement typically to be restricted is external rotation. This is due to inflammation and stiffness in the shoulder joint, which limits the range of motion. Over time, other movements such as flexion, extension, and internal rotation can also become restricted as the condition progresses. However, external rotation tends to be the most affected in the early stages.

questions.text: The posterolateral lesion in the head of humerus in cases of recurrent anterior shoulder dislocation is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Option A-Bankart’s lesion is injury to antero-inferior glenoid labrum. Option B-Hill Sach’s lesion is fracture of posterolateral humeral head in anterior shoulder dislocation. Option C-Reverse Hill- Sachs lesion is fracture of anterolateral humeral head in posterior shoulder dislocation. Option D-Greater tuberosity avulsion can cause shoulder instability.

questions.text: A 42- year-man is diagnosed to have irreparable tear of the rotator cuff. Treatment of choice will be?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Irreparable tear of the rotator cuff is managed by tendon transfer from deltoid and biceps. Option B-Treatment for shoulder arthritis in irreparable tear of the rotator cuff is Total shoulder replacement. Option C-For rotator cuff arthropathy with shoulder arthritis with dysfunctional deltoid is “Reverse shoulder replacement”. Option D-Acromioplasty is not commonly used for irreparable tear of the rotator cuff.

questions.text: A patient of recurrent anterior dislocation presents with the following X-ray, diagnosis is :
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Option A-Bankart’s lesion is injury to antero-inferior glenoid labrum.It is actually a type of “Bony bankart lesion”. Option B-Hill Sach’s lesion is fracture of posterolateral humeral head in anterior shoulder dislocation. Option C-It is actually a fracture of scapula only but bankart lesion is a more specific answer. Option D-Reverse Hill- Sachs lesion is fracture of anterolateral humeral head in posterior shoulder dislocation.

choices.text: A defect in the anterior- inferior capsule

questions.text: Following Defect (lesion) is NOT responsible for recurrent anterior dislocation of shoulder?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Option A-Bankart’s lesion is injury to antero-inferior glenoid labrum.It is actually a type of “Bony bankart lesion”. Option B-Hill Sach’s lesion is fracture of posterolateral humeral head in anterior shoulder dislocation. Option C-There is nothing known as Bristow’s lesion. Option D-A defect in the anterior- inferior capsule can also be responsible for recurrent anterior dislocation of shoulder

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about clavicle
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) 1 Primary and 2 Secondary ossification center. Explanation 1. Clavicle is an Example of long. bone (not a flat bone) 2. Clavicle do not have a Medullary canal. 3. Clavicle Ossifies from 2 Primary and 1 Secondary Ossification 4. It Undergoes Intramembranous ossification (and not Endochondral Ossification)

questions.text: Ist long bone to start ossifying in body is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Clavicle Explanations 1. Clovicle is the Ist "long" bone to start ossifying in body. It's ossification starts by 5th week of lUL 2. Overall, Ear ossicles are the first bones to start ossifying in body 3 & 4. Humerus and femur Ossifies later in IUL.

questions.text: Most common site of fracture clavicle is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Medial 3/5th and lateral 2/5th Medical 3/5th of clavicle is tubular, while lateral 2/5th is flat, hence a their junction is the weakest point of clavicle and is the Mast common site of fracture clavicle:

questions.text: Most Common Complication of Fracture Clavicle:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Mal Union Explanation 1. Clavicle do not Undergo Non union, It Unden goes Malunion. 2. Malunion is Mast common complication of fracture clavicle. 3. Neurovascular injury is Most serious complication of fracture clavicle. 4) None is not the answer here.

questions.text: Which classification is used for clavicular fractures:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Allman's Explanations 1. Neer’s classification is used for proximal humerus fractures 2. Matsen’s classification is used for recurrent shoulder dislocation

questions.text: Most common tendon injured in rotator cuff tear is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Supraspinatus Explanation Supraspinatus is the Most common tendon ruptured in rotator cuff tear.

questions.text: A patient did a vigorous throw of a ball. later, he developed pain and swelling in shoulder joint. You've suspecting acute traumatic supraspinatus tear. What is the lOC for this Condition?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) MRI Explanation. 1. USG is the first Investigation in this condition but it is not the lOC 2. MRI Scan is superior to CT to look at Supraspinatus tendon 3. MRI is the loc for this Condition 4. X-rays are not very. useful in Diagnosis of tendon rupture.

questions.text: Which of the following signs are seen in posterior dislocation of shoulder?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Both of these 1. Due to posterior Dislocation of shoulder, greater tubercle comes anteriorly and appears like the filament of Bulbs resulting in light bulb sign. 2. Because of posterior Dislocation, Glenoid Cavity appears empty known as empty glenoid sign.

questions.text: What is the most common nerve Injured in shoulder dislocation??
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Axillary nerve Since axillary nerve gives a circumflex branch around neck of humerus, It is going to be Injured in shoulder dislocation:

questions.text: Patient comes to ER after a vigorous throw of ball, with Complains of pain in Shoulder. On examination, his shoulder was abducted and externally rotated. You are suspecting anterior shoulder dislocation which of the following Manuvers will you perform?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Modified Kocher’s 1. Modified Allis is done for hip dislocation 2. East Baltimore is also done for hit dislocation 3. Modified Kocher's is Method of choice, in shoulder dislocation

questions.text: What is the sequence of steps done in modified Kocher's Manuver.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Traction > ER > Adduction > IR The sequence can be remembered with a Mnemonic of TEA-I, i.e., traction > ER > adduction > IR. This Manuver is done for reduction of shoulder dislocation.

choices.text: Hydroxyapatite crystals deposition in shoulder joint
Uric acid crystals deposition in shoulder joint

questions.text: Milwaukee Shoulder is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Hydroxyapatite crystals deposition in shoulder joint It's a fact based question, Milwaukee shoulder occurs due to hydroxyapatite crystal deposition in shoulder joint:
